snippet: Western executives say Chinese automakers are starting to ask them to supply parts that meet American and European regulatory standards by 2016.
abstract: Chinese automakers are starting to ask some of the largest Western auto parts companies to supply parts that meet American and European regulatory standards; shift is clearest sign yet that Chinese manufacturers are finally planning high-volume exports to West following more than decade of preparation.
lead_paragraph: Western executives say Chinese automakers are starting to ask them to supply parts that meet American and European regulatory standards by 2016.

headline.main: China Hints at Effort to Export Cars to West
headline.print_headline: China Hints at Effort To Export Cars to West
